DOC.brief_summary: This is a limited safety and feasibility study to evaluate the PVSS Introducer and Paracor Ventricular Support System when used to treat patients with heart failure. The implant, which is loaded onto the delivery system, is placed over the epicardial surface of the right and left ventricles. No formal hypothesis testing will be performed; descriptive statistics will be used to summarize patient outcomes. The results of the study will be used to guide the design and sample size estimation of future studies.
DOC.brief_title: Paracor Ventricular Support System (PVSS) for Patients With Heart Failure
DOC.criteria: NYHA functional class II or III Best medical therapy Ejection fraction <= 35% Heart measurements too large or small for implant sizes Intracardiac thrombus Restrictive cardiomyopathy Not a candidate for sternotomy Expected adhesions Previous coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) Active infection Stroke, surgery, or implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) within 3 months Myocardial infarction (MI) within 1 month
